New Records: Craig Goodwin scored a screamer, a goal that was described as 'exactly how he imagined it' and compared to his World Cup goal
Key Match Events: Xie Wenneng scored against the run of play in the first half
Lewis Miller scored an equalizer with a header
Craig Goodwin scored a decisive goal in the second half
Nishan Velupillay scored his debut goal in stoppage time
Pre-Game Insights: The Socceroos were coming off a shock defeat to Bahrain and a lacklustre draw against Indonesia
Tony Popovic made five changes to the starting lineup compared to Graham Arnold's side
The Socceroos dominated possession early but were caught on the counter-attack
Post-Match Reflections: The Socceroos showed resilience after falling behind early
The victory was crucial for their FIFA World Cup qualification hopes
Craig Goodwin praised the team's character and the importance of the win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Adelaide Oval with a crowd of 46,291
China suffered their fourth straight loss, last happening in 2003
Mitch Duke was substituted due to a shoulder injury
Others: The match was not particularly pretty but the result was what mattered
The Socceroos will face a tougher test against Japan in their next match
